p: Allium senescens L. (A.S.) also has been used as a diuretic, antidote, digestive, antiparasitic, and analgesic agent using the stems and leaves in herbal and folk remedies [ 5]. Though it was reported that A.S. can potentially be developed as therapeutic agents in the treatment of hepatic fibrosis [ 6], little is known about the bioactivity of A.S. against other diseases such as cancer.
